title: Budgeting Basics
summary: Control your money with the 50/30/20 rule.
content: Track your income and expenses carefully. Allocate 50% to needs, 30% to wants, and 20% to savings. Adjust monthly as your income changes.
tips: Use budgeting apps to automate tracking.

title: Emergency Fund
content: Set aside 3–6 months of living expenses to cover emergencies. This prevents debt accumulation during financial shocks.
tips: Keep the fund in a high-yield savings account.

title: Investing 101
content: Invest early to take advantage of compound interest. Diversify across stocks, bonds and ETFs to reduce risk.
tips: Start with index funds for low risk.

title: Smart Spending
content: Make shopping lists, compare prices, and focus on value rather than cost. Track spending habits to reduce unnecessary expenses.
tips: Wait 24 hours before a non-essential purchase.

title: Understanding Loans
content: Loans come with interest rates and repayment terms. Always compare APRs, check late fees, and borrow only what you can repay.

title: Credit Score Basics
summary: Learn how your score affects borrowing.
content: Your credit score represents your creditworthiness. Pay bills on time, keep balances low, and avoid unnecessary credit checks.

title: Compound Interest
content: Money grows faster when interest is earned on both principal and accumulated interest. The earlier you start, the bigger the effect.
tips: Start with small amounts if needed.

title: Taxes & Benefits
content: Learn how income taxes affect your earnings. Explore deductions, credits, and benefits that can reduce tax liability.
tips: Consult a tax advisor if unsure.

title: Digital Payments
content: Use digital wallets and cards securely. Monitor transactions and enable two-factor authentication for safety.

title: Insurance Basics
content: Insurance helps cover risks for health, life, or property. Understand policy terms and ensure coverage matches your needs.
tips: Pay premiums on time to avoid lapses.
